Compliance with Ethical Requirements.question: Has the engagement team complied with the requirements of the Professional Code of Ethics including fundamental principles and conceptual framework issued by ICAI?

Has there been a breach of independence requirement based on engagement team’s assessment of the following threats:

- Self-interest threat (financial/other interest inappropriately influencing behavior)
- Self-review threat (threat that the results of a previous judgement made will not be appropriately evaluated by the professional accountant or another individual within the accountant’s firm)
- Familiarity threat (threat of a long or close relationship with the client)
- Advocacy threat (threat of promotion of client’s or organisation’s position to the extent that professional accountant’s objectivity is compromised)
- Intimidation threat (threat that professional accountant will be deterred from acting objectively)

Agreeing the Terms of Audit Engagement.question:
**Pre-conditions to audit:**
Under the pre-conditions to audit, the auditor shall:
a. Determine whether the financial reporting framework is acceptable;
b. Obtain the agreement of the management that it acknowledges and understands its responsibility
- For preparation of financial statements in accordance with applicable financial reporting framework;
- For design, implementation and maintenance of internal control as management considers necessary; and
- To provide the auditor with:
  • Access to all information;
  • Additional information that the auditor may request from the management for purpose of audit; and
  • Unrestricted access to persons within the entity from whom the auditor determines it necessary to obtain audit evidence.

Has the engagement team agreed with the management on the pre-conditions of audit in accordance with SA 210 “Agreeing the Terms of Audit Engagements”?

Agreeing the Terms of Audit Engagement.question: Are any fees payable by the client or its affiliates (for audit engagement or services other than audit, including those provided by other network firms) overdue during the period of audit engagement?

noteIf.Yes: If all overdue fees will not be paid when the audit report is issued, evaluate the threats to independence from having such fees overdue.

Agreeing the Terms of Audit Engagement.question: Have all fees for professional services related to the audit engagement or other services (including those provided by network firms) provided more than one year prior to the date of audit report been paid by the client and its affiliates before the issuance of the audit report for the current year?

noteIf.No: Coordinate with client and its affiliates to clear outstanding balances. Confirm that all such fees have been paid before the issuance of audit report for the current year.
